oai_dc:dc.dc:description: E-learning has been suggested to help higher education organizations in tourism to achievesustainable development. Thus, this study aims to identify factors determining the learners'needs for e-learning programs, particularly in a tourism curriculum. Based on relevantresearch and the Technology Acceptance Model, the study conducted a survey with 1,109learners in the Central Coastal region of Vietnam. The results show that the e-learningenvironment, perceived ease of use, perceived usefulness, playfulness, and informationtechnology skills have a positive impact on the learner's needs. These findings provide usefulmanagerial implications for e-learning of tourism programs which contributes to thesustainable development of higher education as well as tourism industry through itsworkforce.
